original_data.question: A multi-specialty physician practice is meeting to determine which compensation scheme would best serve the practice and its patient population. Which of the following are true in regards to physician compensation?

options.A: Capitation poses the least financial risk to physicians
options.B: Fee-for-service pays physicians a set amount of money per unit time for every patient under their care
options.C: Fee-for-service may incentivize physicians to increase healthcare utilization irrespective of quality
options.D: Fee-for-service poses the most amount of financial risk to physicians

model_response:
{'A': False, 'B': True, 'C': False, 'D': False}

Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: A physician who receives additional education and training in one particular area of medicine
Money or other benefits received in exchange for work.

The initial patient population refers to all patients to be evaluated by a specific quality measure who share a common set of specified characteristics within a specific measurement set to which a given measure belongs. Details often include information based upon specific age groups, diagnoses, diagnostic and procedure codes, and enrollment periods.
Money or other benefits received in exchange for work.
